  • core_ini_get - Gets the value of a PHPCore configuration directive

  • core_ini_get_all - Gets all configuration options

  • coreinfo - Get PHPCore Information

core_ini_get(string $directive, string $section = 'PHPCore')ÔÉÅ

Gets the value of a PHPCore configuration directive

Returns the value of the PHPCore configuration directive on success. If section is not passed ‚Äòthe [PHPCore] section will be used.

Parameters

  • $directive (string) ‚Äì The configuration directive name.

  • $section (string) ‚Äì The configuration section name.

Returns

string|false Returns the value of the configuration option as a string on success, or an empty string for null values. Returns false if the configuration option doesn‚Äôt exist.

core_ini_get_all(?string $section = null, ?string $sub_section = null)ÔÉÅ

Gets all configuration options

Returns all the registered configuration options.

Parameters

  • $section (string) ‚Äì An optional section name. If not empty, the function returns only options specific for that section.

Returns

array Returns an associative array with directive name as the array key. Returns false and raises an E_WARNING level error if the section doesn‚Äôt exist.

core_ini_set()ÔÉÅ

Sets the value of a configuration directive.

Sets the value of the given PHPCore configuration directive. The configuration directive will keep this new value during the script‚Äôs execution, and will be restored at the script‚Äôs ending. This is similar to PHP ini_set() function.

Parameters

  • $directive (string) ‚Äì The configuration directive name.

  • $section (string) ‚Äì The configuration section name.

  • $value (string) ‚Äì The new value for the option.

Returns

string|false Returns the old value on success, false on failure
